publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-882# Roseanna Cunningham: Edinburgh Folk Festival—That the Parliament notes with concern the demise of the Edinburgh Folk Festival as a result of lack of financial backing; further notes that during a meeting attended in April by musicians, former festival volunteers, members of the Adult Learning Project’s Scots Music Group, members of Edinburgh Folk Club, the Wee Folk Club, Scottish Traditions of Dance Trust and others, concern was expressed about a perceived lack of political support for the traditional arts, and asks the Executive to recognise and encourage the important role of the traditional arts in its forthcoming National Cultural Strategy.
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Fiona McLeod*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Shona Robison*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*, Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*

S1M-882# Roseanna Cunningham: Edinburgh Folk Festival—That the Parliament notes with concern the demise of the Edinburgh Folk Festival as a result of lack of financial backing; further notes that during a meeting attended in April by musicians, former festival volunteers, members of the Adult Learning Project’s Scots Music Group, members of Edinburgh Folk Club, the Wee Folk Club, Scottish Traditions of Dance Trust and others, concern was expressed about a perceived lack of political support for the traditional arts, and asks the Executive to recognise and encourage the important role of the traditional arts in its forthcoming National Cultural Strategy. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Michael Russell*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Linda Fabiani*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Alex Neil*

S1M-882# Roseanna Cunningham: Edinburgh Folk Festival-That the Parliament notes with concern the demise of the Edinburgh Folk Festival as a result of lack of financial backing; further notes that during a meeting attended in April by musicians, former festival volunteers, members of the Adult Learning Project's Scots Music Group, members of Edinburgh Folk Club, the Wee Folk Club, Scottish Traditions of Dance Trust and others, concern was expressed about a perceived lack of political support for the traditional arts, and asks the Executive to recognise and encourage the important role of the traditional arts in its forthcoming National Cultural Strategy. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Alex Neil, Bill Aitken*, Alex Fergusson*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Michael Matheson*

S1M-882# Roseanna Cunningham: Edinburgh Folk Festival-That the Parliament notes with concern the demise of the Edinburgh Folk Festival as a result of lack of financial backing; further notes that during a meeting attended in April by musicians, former festival volunteers, members of the Adult Learning Project's Scots Music Group, members of Edinburgh Folk Club, the Wee Folk Club, Scottish Traditions of Dance Trust and others, concern was expressed about a perceived lack of political support for the traditional arts, and asks the Executive to recognise and encourage the important role of the traditional arts in its forthcoming National Cultural Strategy. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Alex Neil, Bill Aitken, Alex Fergusson, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Michael Matheson, Robin Harper*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Mr Jamie Stone*, Nick Johnston*, Cathy Peattie*

S1M-882# Roseanna Cunningham: Edinburgh Folk Festival—That the Parliament notes with concern the demise of the Edinburgh Folk Festival as a result of lack of financial backing; further notes that during a meeting attended in April by musicians, former festival volunteers, members of the Adult Learning Project’s Scots Music Group, members of Edinburgh Folk Club, the Wee Folk Club, Scottish Traditions of Dance Trust and others, concern was expressed about a perceived lack of political support for the traditional arts, and asks the Executive to recognise and encourage the important role of the traditional arts in its forthcoming National Cultural Strategy. Supported by: Fiona McLeod, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Shona Robison, Christine Grahame, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fergus Ewing, Nora Radcliffe, Donald Gorrie, Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Andrew Wilson, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Alex Neil, Bill Aitken, Alex Fergusson, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Michael Matheson, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Jamie Stone, Nick Johnston, Cathy Peattie, Maureen Macmillan*
S1M-882# Edinburgh Folk Festival (lodged on 19 May 2000) Irene McGugan*
